body.p: The Simal REST module provides a web application that exposes the Simal repository via a REST API.
body.warning: This module is in an alpha state. The API is liable to change iun response to discussion on the Simal developer mailing list .
body.note: Our documentation is quite sparse at present. Please ask for help on our mailing list and we'll be sure to expand the documentation in response to your questions. Unless you ask, we don;t know what people need to see.

ul.li: Simal REST uses Maven to manage its dependencies. This means that you only need to ensure your system has the following items installed, everything else will be downloaded automatically.

section.title: Simal Core
section.p: Simal REST uses Simal Core an open source framework for storage, inferencing and querying of project and community data.

We use the latest code, during development, from this project. Therefore it is necessary for you to download the source for
Simal Core download
. If you are working with Maven you will also need to install Simal Core in your local repository. At some point we'll simplify this set up, but at the time of writing we are new to Maven and have not yet figured out the best configuration, if you know Maven we would welcome your help .

section.title: Getting the Source
section.p: The source code of Simal REST is available from our Subversion repository .

section.p: There are two ways of running the REST API for testing, either...
Then point your browser at http://localhost:8080/simal-rest
or...
Run the src/test/java/uk/ac/osswatch/simal/rest/Start class.
Then point your browser at http://localhost:8080/simal-rest
